isis.stitle: DT-466E and 530E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1995) - SUPPLEMENTAL DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS - DIAGNOSTIC ANALYIS PROCEDURES FOR EXCESSIVE EXHAUST SMOKE

svcproc.title: DIAGNOSTIC ANALYIS PROCEDURES FOR EXCESSIVE EXHAUST SMOKE

step1.para: Excessive visual smoke can occur under two separate general conditions:

Excessive visual exhaust smoke can be caused by improper operation of the vehicle. For example, the driver must keep the engine speed within the specified rpm range for the transmission and rear axle ratio.
Diagnosis of this problem is critical.

step2.para: Check the air induction system and air cleaner restriction.
Inspect the turbocharger for signs of lube oil leakage in the compressor housing.
Inspect the cooling system; Low operatiing temperature can cause blue smoke.
Excessive lube oil consumption can cause blue smoke.
Constant gray smoke can be caused by the air induction system.
BLACK SMOKE - must be immediately corrected. All appropriate areas of HARD START NO START AND PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTIC FORM EGED-150 must be investigated to determine the cause.
WHITE SMOKE - May indicate excess fuel on cold start with insufficient cranking speed.
These conditions result in misfiring with warm engine.
